title: Rumors
data:
**Rumors** are a way to learn about the game of *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")* without reading [spoilers](/wiki/Spoiler "Spoiler"). Rumors are classified as either "true" or "false". True rumors are useful hints, while false ones are useless or incorrect.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Getting rumors](#Getting_rumors)

- [2 Examples](#Examples)

  - [2.1 True rumors](#True_rumors)
  - [2.2 False rumors](#False_rumors)

- [3 See also](#See_also)

- [4 External links](#External_links)

## Getting rumors

- [The Oracle](/wiki/Oracle_\(monster\) "Oracle (monster)") always tells you a true rumor when you pay for a minor consultation.

- The following items give you a true rumor if blessed, a false rumor if cursed and either if uncursed:

  - [Fortune cookies](/wiki/Fortune_cookie "Fortune cookie") contain a rumor that is revealed when you eat the cookie. You may also just [read](/wiki/Read "Read") the cookie, if you want to keep the vegan or foodless [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").
  - Two [quest artifacts](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), [the Magic Mirror of Merlin](/wiki/The_Magic_Mirror_of_Merlin "The Magic Mirror of Merlin") and [the Master Key of Thievery](/wiki/The_Master_Key_of_Thievery "The Master Key of Thievery"), give a rumor when applied or wielded.

- You can sometimes find rumors written as [graffiti](/wiki/Graffiti "Graffiti") on the floor. Sometimes these can be difficult to read.
  - You can write something on the dungeon floor, then engrave with a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") to get a rumor.

## Examples

### True rumors

- Rumor #330: *Throwing food at a wild dog might tame him.*

This encourages the player to throw [tripe](/wiki/Tripe "Tripe") at dogs to tame them.

- Rumor #47: *Eating a freezing sphere is like eating a yeti.*

This suggests that by eating a [freezing sphere](/wiki/Freezing_sphere "Freezing sphere") or a [yeti](/wiki/Yeti "Yeti") you may get the [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance"). Unfortunately, freezing spheres never leave corpses.

- Rumor #326: *They say the gods get angry if you kill your dog.*

This suggests that if you kill a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), you get an [alignment record](/wiki/Alignment_record "Alignment record") penalty (−15 to be exact, and also lose 1 point of [Luck](/wiki/Luck "Luck")).

### False rumors

- Rumor #7: *A cockatrice corpse is guaranteed to be untainted!*

This encourages the player to eat a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") corpse, which will almost certainly cause death by [stoning](/wiki/Stoning "Stoning").

- Rumor #157: *Sorry, no fortune this time. Better luck next cookie!*

This is just plain useless.

- Rumor #195: *They say that a hacker named David once slew a giant with a sling and a rock.*

Some false rumors are just random references to random things. ([Slings](/wiki/Sling "Sling") and [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock") have no special effect against [giants](/wiki/Giant "Giant").)

## See also

- [Source:rumors.tru](/wiki/Source:Rumors.tru "Source:Rumors.tru") — the data file that contains all the true rumors
- [Source:rumors.fal](/wiki/Source:Rumors.fal "Source:Rumors.fal") — the data file that contains all the false rumors
- [Rumor messages](/wiki/Rumor_messages "Rumor messages") — explains the meaning of each rumor

## External links

- [alt.org - NetHack Addi(c)tion: Random Messages](http://alt.org/nethack/addmsgs/)
